Teen missing at Sugarloaf

Officials said a search is underway for 17-year-old Nicholas Joy of Medford who was reported missing from the Maine ski resort yesterday. (2:19 p.m.)

Judge: Bulger didn't have 'license to kill'

The judge presiding over James "Whitey" Bulger's case ruled no law permits an immunized witness to murder after agreeing to help law enforcement. (3:07 p.m.)

Mansfield dog in attack that required 400 stitches for boy to be euthanized

The owners of the Mansfield dog gave the OK for it to be euthanized after the pointer-hound mix attacked a 16-year-old girl. (1:06 p.m.)

Psychiatrist: Rage, not psychosis, drove Nathaniel Fujita, to kill ex-girlfriend

A psychiatrist for the prosecution today testified that Nathaniel Fujita was "acting out in a very brutal way" when he killed Lauren Astley. (11:49 a.m.)
  • 3/1 Doctor: Fujita couldn't control himself when he killed

NYPD seeks suspect in deaths of expectant parents

Police are looking for Julio Acevedo after the deaths of pregnant woman and her husband, police said. The baby died a day later. (1:46 p.m.)

Backdrop of discord as
cardinals gather in Rome

As the College of Cardinals prepares to choose a new pope to follow Benedict XVI, the tableau is rife with Vatican rivalry and controversy.
Opinion | James Carroll

Will church address its real issues?

In choosing a new pope, the cardinals must be open to someone who will move the church forward in its teachings on sex and gender equality.

System predicts patients’ problems

New technology at Boston Children’s Hospital allows doctors to track several monitors providing data on a patient on a single display.
Opinion | John E. Sununu

D.C.’s version of ‘Who’s on First?’

Washington remains a place where politicians often believe they are saying one thing while much of the world hears something entirely different.

3-D pen garners $2m in backing

The Somerville toy and robotics start-up Wobbleworks far exceeded its $30,000 fundraising goal on Kickstarter for their 3-D pen, the 3Doodler.
Opinion | Juliette Kayyem

Focus aid on Syrian refugees

Everyone will be better off if the US uses humanitarian assistance toward emergency resources to keep refugees from destabilizing the region.

Worrying about adult ADHD

It’s not just a childhood problem. Millions of adults may have undiagnosed attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.
